title: Japan beat Canada 2-1
description: COVENTRY， Great Britain， July 25 (Xinhua) -- Defending world champions Japan got off to a good start in their Olympic campaign after they beat Canada 2-1 in their opening group match of the women's soccer competitions on Wednesday.
cleanContent: COVENTRY, Great Britain, July 25 (Xinhua) -- Defending world champions Japan got off to a good start in their Olympic campaign after they beat Canada 2-1 in their opening group match of the women's soccer competitions on Wednesday.Winger Nahomi Kawasumi opened the scoring in the 33rd minute, and playmaker Aya Miyama made it 2-0 in the 44th minute with a looping header that evaded the outrushing Canadian goalkeeper Erin McLeod.Striker Melissa Tancred pulled one back for Canada in the 55th minute.																																																																								|  |
